title: Roller Coaster Weekend
text:
Roller Coaster Weekend is the debut solo studio album by the American recording artist <a href="Joe%20Vitale%20%28musician%29">Joe Vitale</a>. It was originally released in 1974, on the label <a href="Atlantic%20Records">Atlantic</a>. The album wasn't a commercial success and was his last solo album until 1981's <a href="Plantation%20Harbor">Plantation Harbor</a> (released 7 years later). After the recording of "Roller Coaster Weekend", Vitale would join the <a href="Long%20May%20You%20Run">Stills-Young band</a> and tour with <a href="Crosby%2C%20Stills%2C%20Nash%20%26amp%3B%20Young">Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young</a> line-up, as well as the <a href="Eagles%20%28band%29">Eagles</a>.
The song "Falling," was borrowed in part for <a href="Joe%20Walsh">Joe Walsh</a>'s song "At the Station", later recorded and released on Walsh's fourth solo album "<a href="But%20Seriously%2C%20Folks...">But Seriously, Folks...</a>" (1978)
Critical reception.
In a retrospective review by <a href="AllMusic">AllMusic</a> critic Rob Caldwell gave the album a star rating of 2 out of 5 (meaning "Poor") and he stated that considering the stalwart guitarists featured on the album it's a "song-oriented album" and he also added that the album "never quite gets off the ground."
Personnel.
Credits are adapted from the album's liner notes.
